message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Romania. I need to provide responses to 10 statements about AI in education.

Let me think about reasonable responses from the perspective of a Romanian teacher:

TT4G35A: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - This is generally a positive use case. Most teachers would likely agree with this as AI tools can help with lesson planning. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35B: "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - This is also a positive capability of AI. Teachers would likely agree this is possible. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35C: "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - Personalized learning is a known benefit of AI. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35D: "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)." - This is a positive application. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35E: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - This is clearly a positive use of AI. Most teachers would agree. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35F: "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - This is about academic dishonesty/plagiarism. This is a concern with AI. I would say teachers would agree this is a risk. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35G: "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - This is a valid concern about AI limitations. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35H: "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - This is a concern about AI bias. This is a legitimate worry. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35I: "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data." - This is a concern about data privacy with AI systems. 

Data protection is a legitimate concern, so I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35J: "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students." - This is a concern about AI recommendations for teaching methods. I'll say "Agree"

Now I need to structure these responses using the json_tool_call function with the appropriate format.
